page.title: 20LONGDENDALE RESERVOIRS
page.content:
Five reservoirs were built in the Longdendale Valley during the 19th century. They were built to supply water to Manchester. However the two in the survey area - Bottoms and Valehouse - were too low to supply water and were used to contain flood and overflow water. They also supplied water to the mills along the Etherow. The chief engineer, J.F.Bateman, lived in Arnfield Tower built for him in 1850. Situated in Tintwistle it is now a field study centre. Today Bottoms Reservoir is used for recreation purposes such as fishing and yachting. *****************
